output.conclusion: This course provided a comprehensive overview of wireless communication principles and technologies. By understanding the fundamentals and exploring various modulation techniques, multiple access methods, and network architectures, you are now equipped to analyze, design, and implement wireless communication systems effectively. Further exploration into specific areas of interest, such as 5G/6G, IoT, or satellite communication, will enhance your expertise in this dynamic field.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Wireless Communication course! This intermediate-level course delves into the fundamental principles and technologies that underpin modern wireless communication systems. We will explore various modulation techniques, multiple access methods, and network architectures, providing you with a solid foundation for understanding and working with wireless technologies.

chapters.description: Overview of wireless communication systems, advantages and disadvantages, applications, and the electromagnetic spectrum.
Exploration of signal propagation mechanisms, including reflection, diffraction, and scattering. Understanding path loss models like Friis transmission equation and practical considerations.
Introduction to antenna parameters such as gain, directivity, polarization, and impedance matching. Different antenna types and their applications.
Amplitude Modulation (AM), Frequency Modulation (FM), and Phase Modulation (PM). Analysis of their characteristics, advantages, and disadvantages.
Amplitude Shift Keying (ASK), Frequency Shift Keying (FSK), Phase Shift Keying (PSK), and Quadrature Amplitude Modulation (QAM). Detailed exploration of their principles and performance.
Introduction to channel coding techniques for error detection and correction. Linear block codes, convolutional codes, and their applications in wireless systems.

Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA), Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA), Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA), and Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiple Access (OFDMA). Comparison of their characteristics and applications.
Cellular networks, ad hoc networks, wireless LANs (WLANs), and wireless personal area networks (WPANs). Exploration of their architectures, protocols, and applications.
Overview of various wireless communication standards such as IEEE 802.11 (Wi-Fi), Bluetooth, Zigbee, and cellular standards (e.g., 4G LTE, 5G). Key features and characteristics of each standard.
